verses.verse: A Psalm <WH4210> or Song <WH7892> for the sabbath <WH7676> day <WH3117>. It is a good <WH2896> thing to give thanks <WH3034> unto the LORD <WH3068>, and to sing praises <WH2167> unto thy name <WH8034>, O most High <WH5945>:
To shew forth <WH5046> thy lovingkindness <WH2617> in the morning <WH1242>, and thy faithfulness <WH530> every night <WH3915>, every: Heb. in the nights
Upon an instrument of ten strings <WH6218>, and upon the psaltery <WH5035>; upon the harp <WH3658> with a solemn sound <WH1902>. the harp: or, the solemn sound with the harp a solemn: Heb. Higgaion
For thou, LORD <WH3068>, hast made me glad <WH8055> through thy work <WH6467>: I will triumph <WH7442> in the works <WH4639> of thy hands <WH3027>.
O LORD <WH3068>, how great <WH1431> are thy works <WH4639>! and thy thoughts <WH4284> are very <WH3966> deep <WH6009>.
A brutish <WH1198> man <WH376> knoweth <WH3045> not; neither doth a fool <WH3684> understand <WH995> this.

When the wicked <WH7563> spring <WH6524> as the grass <WH6212>, and when all the workers <WH6466> of iniquity <WH205> do flourish <WH6692>; it is that they shall be destroyed <WH8045> for ever <WH5703>:
But thou, LORD <WH3068>, art most high <WH4791> for evermore <WH5769>.
For, lo, thine enemies <WH341>, O LORD <WH3068>, for, lo, thine enemies <WH341> shall perish <WH6>; all the workers <WH6466> of iniquity <WH205> shall be scattered <WH6504>.
But my horn <WH7161> shalt thou exalt <WH7311> like the horn of an unicorn <WH7214>: I shall be anointed <WH1101> with fresh <WH7488> oil <WH8081>.
Mine eye <WH5869> also shall see <WH5027> my desire on mine enemies <WH7790>, and mine ears <WH241> shall hear <WH8085> my desire of the wicked <WH7489> that rise up <WH6965> against me.
The righteous <WH6662> shall flourish <WH6524> like the palm tree <WH8558>: he shall grow <WH7685> like a cedar <WH730> in Lebanon <WH3844>.
Those that be planted <WH8362> in the house <WH1004> of the LORD <WH3068> shall flourish <WH6524> in the courts <WH2691> of our God <WH430>.
They shall still bring forth fruit <WH5107> in old age <WH7872>; they shall be fat <WH1879> and flourishing <WH7488>; flourishing: Heb. green
To shew <WH5046> that the LORD <WH3068> is upright <WH3477>: he is my rock <WH6697>, and there is no unrighteousness <WH5766> <WH5766> in him.
